metadata.title: CVE-2022-23304 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
The implementations of EAP-pwd in hostapd before 2.10 and wpa_supplicantbefore 2.10 are vulnerable to side-channel attacks as a result of cacheaccess patterns. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix forCVE-2019-9495.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eapoltest - 2:2.10-21
hostapd - 2:2.10-21
wpagui - 2:2.10-21
wpasupplicant - 2:2.10-21
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:2.10-21').
